publications.name: Study of Intelligent Evacuation Systems of High-Rise Buildings in India-a review
publications.publisher: IEEE 2016 International Conference on Computing, Analytics and Security Trends (CAST)
publications.summary: This paper presents literature review of intelligent evacuation management systems in high-rise buildings all over the world so as to validate it to improve the evacuation systems in existing high-rise buildings in India. It studies means of egress, evacuation strategies & models along with crowd monitoring and prediction strategies employed in high-rise buildings. Based on this review, the author presents a decision model using information available in the form building and egress specifications as well as information variables like occupant density (RFID technology), spread and location of fire (Smoke Sensor Technology), etc. to guide the rescue team for fast and safe evacuation of building occupants

work.company: The Clifford Lab, Emory University & Georgia Institute of Technology (Advisor: Gari Clifford, DPhil)
work.summary: Technology: Image Processing, Deep Learning, Python, TensorFlow

work.company: Ubiquitous Computing Research Group, Georgia Institute of Technology (Advisor: Prof. Gregory Abowd)
work.summary: Technology: Python, scikit-learn,pandas, eating-gesture-recognition, android-feature-computation, Android Java
highlights: Worked on a study on eating and well-being in college students under a multi-institution project CampusLife- An effort to improve student well-being through digital data
Build algorithm for android-based feature computation of raw sensor data previously executed in Python in a Desktop environment

Developed pipeline for visualization (Plotly), cleaning & augmentation of data collected through self-report surveys and eating gesture raw data from off-the-shelf wrist watch and mobile application data
Build algorithm to test correlation between meal patterns,meal company/environment, mental well-being and mobile data
Recently submitted research paper on this work to ACM Interactive, Mobile Wearable and Ubiquitous Technologies (IMWUT) 2020

work.company: Department of Biomedical Informatics, Emory University (Advisor: Gari Clifford, DPhil)
work.summary: Technology: Image Processing, OCR, Convolutional Neural Networks, Python, TensorFlow, Augmentor
highlights: Worked on digitization of readings of medical device displays using images taken from a cellphone camera

Build a deep learning model to recognize & monitor blood pressure(BP) readings of preeclamptic populations of rural Guatemala using cellphone camera images of digital BP meter displays collected in a study
Generated an artificial dataset using a blank BP LCD image and a realistic font, augmented by realistic noises similar in visual appearance to test data to improve estimation accuracy.
Mean absolute error after estimation on artificial BP images: Systolic BP(0.1 mmHg), Diastolic BP(0.2 mmHg)

work.summary: Technology: Python, mySQL, triage, Docker, Linux, HTML, CSS
highlights: Worked on a triage food inspection project using Linux, Docker & mySQL as a proof-of-concept of early-warning systems using a machine learning model
Performed preprocessing on self-reported well-being data from patient, therapist and caregiver as well as patient audio data
Assisted with company website and interactive quizzes development
